page.title: 04RECREATION ON CLIFTON ESTATE
page.content: There are a wide range of clubs for children in Clifton but there are not many parks and in these the type of facilities vary considerably. {Sunninghill Park}contains a small climbing frame, giant swings, a small slide and a roundabout.There is also a lot of grass for games and a few trees for climbing. The other parks are smaller, the equipment is rusted, often vandalised and there is a lot of litter and glass on the floor.There is also the{"Flower" Park }but this is just grass and flowers and has no special facilities for children. Clubs include, the{Boy's Brigade, {Scouts, Cub Scouts, Guides}and {Brownies.}There a number of{marching {bands, a football team}and{boxing, {judo}and{karate clubs.}There are three {youth clubs}on the estate, and a {swimming baths.
